channel.title: Virtual Mouse
channel.description: Well, is it hard to make a mouse in java or something because if that would be possible, it could use that mouse in its own window. It looks like Ibot uses its own mouse, but why can't we? Is it hard to make? Doesn't sounds hard to me, but i could be completely wrong lol. I want to auto more, but i need my computer for other things than autoing so I dont much.

item.title: Virtual Mouse
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

The Java tutorial on the Sun java website or checkout the Java section here.

Alternatively buy a book.

Read full topic

item.title: Virtual Mouse
item.dc:creator: @Rune_Hacker1 Rune Hacker
item.description:
@Rune_Hacker1 wrote:

Where do you find tuts on stuff like that? Do you just need to look through all the imports and find it yourslef or what? Because from tuts, they do teach a lot, but i know there are still hundreds of thousands of other commands in java which i know nothing about.

Read full topic

item.title: Virtual Mouse
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

You do realize once you’ve loaded the client and made your “mouse” you need to use either Bytecode or Colour recognition to make the bot work. Whichever you chose with little Java knowledge you wont get far… I advise learning the language first and then trying in a few months time

Not trying to come down hard or anything, just trying to point you in the right direction

Read full topic

item.title: Virtual Mouse
item.dc:creator: @shangtsung1 shangtsung1
item.description:
@shangtsung1 wrote:

[quote=“BAsh(CntLgn), post:10, topic:102570”]It depends what you are going to do with your bot. If you want to see the screen to click some where it will need to be visible.

However it is possiblt to use java to capture the screen without it being visible. I havnt looked at cherokee in a while so i’m not sure if this is implemented.[/quote]

ibot uses a canvas hack in pro allows you too minimize the bot

Read full topic

item.description:

it looks like for cherokee, you need the window in sight though, i want to completely minimize the window.

you can

item.title: Virtual Mouse
item.dc:creator: @BAsh_CntLgn BAsh(CntLgn)
item.description:
@BAsh_CntLgn wrote:

It depends what you are going to do with your bot. If you want to see the screen to click some where it will need to be visible.

However it is possiblt to use java to capture the screen without it being visible. I havnt looked at cherokee in a while so i’m not sure if this is implemented.

Read full topic

item.title: Virtual Mouse
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Cherokee already has the code written for running the client inside a basic window with a mouse for that window, tabs would require a small edit.

(as to what mopar means, it basically stands for dodge, plymouth, chrysler and jeep http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mopar)

Read full topic

item.title: Virtual Mouse
item.dc:creator: @Rune_Hacker1 Rune Hacker
item.description:
@Rune_Hacker1 wrote:

Ok, cool.

Im the 18th post on that thread lol.

Also, i want to make a basic java window with the runescape client inside it, and once thats done, i want to make a mouse for that specific window that will auto. Would this be possible because imagine putting tabs on that java window and youve got multiple windows open eac hwith thier own running mouse and autoin lol. Sounds possible from what you 2 have said, but i know very little about java lol.

Thanks for the help Pwnd and Moparisthebest btw.

(P.S. ive been wonderign what mopar means :P)

Read full topic

item.title: Virtual Mouse
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Making a ‘virtual mouse’ in java is not detectable at all if done right, I did it in cherokee (http://sourceforge.net/projects/cherokee/), if you want to see an example of SCAR using the ‘virtual mouse’ in cherokee so that you can use your real mouse for other things, or run more bots, check out what yakman wrote here:

http://www.srl-forums.com/forum/setting-up-cherokee-t10752.html

Read full topic

item.title: Virtual Mouse
item.dc:creator: @Rune_Hacker1 Rune Hacker
item.description:
@Rune_Hacker1 wrote:

Well, if making a mouse in java is very detectable, how has Ibot made thier mouse not that detectable? If they found out how, could we or are thye using somehting else to make the virtual mouse?

Read full topic

item.title: Virtual Mouse
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

It is the mouse, how it sends events, how it moves, presence of other ‘mice’. Lots of variables. And of course it can.

Read full topic

item.title: Virtual Mouse

item.description:
@Rune_Hacker1 wrote:

Runescape can detect a java mouse? Because srl scripts use randomness adn stuff which. Would that randomness help or no, its the mouse itself?

Read full topic

item.title: Virtual Mouse

item.description:

It’s not necessarily hard. Making an undetectable one is, tbh.
